text.section: Unless a written protest is filed with the Secretary, a State adopted federal regulation takes effect in this State on the date that it becomes effective as a federal rule or regulation.

Any person who may be affected adversely by a State adopted federal regulation may:
File a protest against the State adopted federal regulation not more than 30 days after its effective date; and
Request a hearing.
A protest under this section stays the effect of the State adopted federal regulation as a rule or regulation of this State.
